com.orbitz.monitoring.api
Interface CompositeMonitor

All Superinterfaces:
Monitor
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractCompositeMonitor, SerializableCompositeMonitor, TransactionMonitor
public interface CompositeMonitor
extends Monitor

A monitor that holds related submonitors. This can be useful for gathering multiple monitors and correlating them with some parent monitor.

Children of CompositeMonitors will implicitly inherit their parent's inheritable attributes. CompositeMonitors can designate attributes as inheritable by using the setInheritable methods. Attributes are not inheritable when using the set methods.

Method Detail

addChildMonitor

void addChildMonitor(Monitor monitor)
Adds a child monitor to this composite monitor. The interface makes no prescription as to whether the children are ordered.

Parameters:
monitor - the Monitor to be added as a child of this Monitor

getChildMonitors

java.util.Collection<Monitor> getChildMonitors()
Gets the child monitors of this monitors.

Returns:
a collection of child monitors that were captured. This returns an empty collection if none were set.

getInheritableAttributes

java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getInheritableAttributes()
Gets those attributes that can be inherited by the child monitors. These attributes will be added to the child monitor when it is created.

Returns:
a reference to the map of the inheritable attributes that should be added to the child monitors

getInheritableAttributeHolders

java.util.Map<java.lang.String,CompositeAttributeHolder> getInheritableAttributeHolders()
Gets all attribute holders for which CompositeAttributeHolder.isInheritable() is true

Returns:
the inheritable holders
